intro: Basselinia porphyrea, commonly known as the Porphyritic Basselinia, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its distinctive purple-tinged leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
